text: Probate is how the will of a dead person is taken and used by a court. Probate checks that paying the dead person's debts, and giving away the dead person's money and property follows the instructions in the will. In many jurisdictions the court where probate happens is called a probate court. Probate follows these steps: *Filing of the will and opening an estate in the probate court, *Giving notice of the probate proceeding to legal heirs, beneficiaries, and creditors, *Checking that the will is legal and valid, *Figuring out the value of the property in the dead person's estate, *Paying the debts of the estate, including taxes, and *Giving the heirs of the estate their inheritances, the gifts that the dead person left to them in the will. For people who die without much money or property, many jurisdictions allow simple probate that is cheaper and easier to do. ==References== Category:Property law
